com.inqwell.any

Class EvalExpr

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.inqwell.any.AbstractFunc
      • com.inqwell.any.EvalExpr
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Any, Func, NamedFunc, Serializable, Cloneable

    public class EvalExpr
extends AbstractFunc
implements Cloneable
    Contains a binary or unary mathematical operator and applies that operator to the given structure. Instances can be chained to build complex expressions as operands can themselves be functions. Here's an example 

     // Establish some LocateNode instances to track down the items of interest
 // in the structure we wish to apply the expression to...
 LocateNode qty       = new LocateNode("qty");
 LocateNode loanValue = new LocateNode("loanValue");
 LocateNode mid       = new LocateNode("mid");

 // ...then create an expression whose logic is:
   (loanValue > (qty * mid * 1.25)) || (loanValue < (qty * mid * 0.75))
 EvalExpr priceError =
  new EvalExpr (new EvalExpr (loanValue,
                              new EvalExpr (qty
                                            new EvalExpr (mid,
                                                          new AnyFloat(1.25),
                                                          new Multiply()),
                                            new Multiply()),
                              new GreaterThan()),
                new EvalExpr (loanValue,
                              new EvalExpr (qty
                                            new EvalExpr (mid,
                                                          new AnyFloat(0.75),
                                                          new Multiply()),
                                            new Multiply()),
                              new LessThan()),
                new LogicalOr());

 // To execute the expression on a given structure 's' containing the required
 // elements:
 AnyBoolean b = (AnyBoolen)priceError.exec(s)
 if (b.getValue())
 {
   // handle the loan value outside 25% of market value
 }

    In the above example the expression priceError can be applied to any structure containing the required items.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $
    Author:
    $Author: sanderst $
    See Also:
    OperatorVisitor, Serialized Form

      • EvalExpr

        public EvalExpr(Any op1)
        Create an expression which performs the Null operator on the given operand. The Null operator simply returns the given operand although if the operand is a Func it will be executed until a scalar is arrived at.

        This construction is useful for evaluating other expression types such as Ternary which can return Funcs.

        public EvalExpr()

      • evalFunc

        public static Any evalFunc(Transaction t,
                           Any root,
                           Any a,
                           Class c,
                           Class execWhile)
                    throws AnyException
        Evaluate a Func or derived until an instance other than that given by execWhile is returned. If argument a implements execWhile then it is evaluated on the structure given by root. This process is repeated until the result is not a execWhile implementation.

        If ultimate target requires transaction arbitration then this is performed. Thus, if the target is a transactional Map any transaction private instance will actually be returned. If the target is a leaf within a t-Map then any private instance of that will be returned also.

        Parameters:
        t - the desired transaction context to propagate
        root - the structure passed to exec if a is a Func
        a - the operand
        execWhile - the class that the operand must satisfy while evaluation continues. Must be a Func or derived.
        c - the class a (or its evaluation) must be an instance of. May be null in which case this condition is not imposed.
        Returns:
        a if a is not a execWhile or a.exec(root) until not a execWhile
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - is the return value is not an instance of class c
        AnyException

      • resolveOperand

        public static Any resolveOperand(Transaction t,
                                 Any root,
                                 Any a)
                          throws AnyException
        Resolve an operand reference to the operand itself. Operand references are instances of the Locate interface which are executed until an operand (which may be another Func) is reached.

        If the operand resolution yields an Expression then this, in turn, will be requested to resolve its operands. Hence an expression network can be prepared for execution, as opposed to actually executing it, which is done through the normal Func.exec method. With a pre-constructed function network, there is no need to separate operand resolution and function execution

        Throws:
        AnyException

      • exec

        public Any exec(Any a)
         throws AnyException
        Description copied from interface: Func
        Execute the function with the specified argument. In many cases this argument will be a node in an Any structure which contains the necessary elements required by the function.
        Specified by:
        exec in interface Func
        Throws:
